page.title: 14FESTIVALS-CARNIVAL PART2
page.content: {It costs Â£600}to hold the carnival. Coffee mornings ,fun runs ,disco's, barbeques,raffles and bingos are held to raise money to pay for the bands ,prizes, Queen's dresses, advertising and buying refreshments .The profit goes towards the next carnival. You have to fill in a form costing 10p to be in the carnival. {The procession}takes 2 hours to travel around the village starting at the playing field and ending at the Cornish Arms, the pub by the church. This year the carnival will end at the Playing Field as an experiment. Each class at the local school hope to enter as a walking group,Class 4 as Domesday St.Merryn,Class 3 as the Pied Piper and Rats,Class 2 Alice in Wonderland and Class 1 as Snowmen.
